question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola makes a public announcement regarding the recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The contamination must specifically involve metallic substances present in the food items. If no such recall takes place within the designated timeframe, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:

2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually carrying it out by the specified date does not qualify for a YES conclusion.

question.title: Will Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Colorado news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. The question will resolve as NO if neither condition is met within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, there exist trustworthy reports or formal alerts from election authorities, governmental bodies, or respected news organizations indicating that Google's AI assistant is distributing misleading information regarding elections. For this question, 'misleading information regarding elections' pertains to inaccurate or deceptive details about electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Trustworthy reports must originate from at least two of the following entities: state or federal election officials, major news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or prominent US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in esteemed journals. The reports or alerts must explicitly reference the AI assistant and its involvement in the dissemination of misleading election information. If no such reports or alerts are made by the resolution deadline, the question will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body:

1. The relocation must be publicly declared by the company or its executives.
2. This declaration must be covered by at least two major, trustworthy news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters should be functional in Austin, Texas, with essential executive operations transferred.

Any partial moves or plans that are still underway by July 31, 2024, will not qualify for a YES answer. If the relocation is not finalized and operational by this date, or if the company opts not to proceed with the move, the resolution will be NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Georgia regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:

1. The public vote must be formally declared and executed by the government of Georgia.
2. The public vote must directly tackle the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or by well-known news outlets.

This inquiry will be considered negative if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. An intended public vote is called off or delayed past the mentioned date.
3. A public vote is conducted, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the results of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Italy's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with YES if, by the end of July 2024, the Italian economy has not fallen into a recession. A recession is characterized, for this purpose, as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Italian economy faces two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Federal Reserve's favored inflation indicator (commonly the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially documented by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government body (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and confirmed by at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If such an increase is not reported within this timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that this question pertains specifically to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

(b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. The expansion of the AI-focused workforce must be clearly articulated and not just inferred from broader hiring objectives. If no such declaration occurs by the specified date, or if Samsung only communicates plans to sustain or reduce its AI-related workforce, the inquiry resolves as FALSE. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, not the actual execution of those intentions.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

Any conjecture regarding prospective rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual members of the Central Bank of Israel will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are reliable reports from a minimum of two prominent international news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) regarding significant demonstrations in the UK specifically in reaction to the government's choice to reduce healthcare funding. To be considered 'significant', the demonstrations must involve at least 1,000 individuals in one gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants throughout the UK. The demonstrations must be directly associated with the matter of healthcare funding reductions. If no such demonstrations fulfilling these requirements take place by the designated date, or if the funding cuts are revoked prior to triggering such demonstrations, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) the U.S. SEC's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024, or (b) the NASDAQ Composite index reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, this part resolves as NO. (b) At any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the NASDAQ Composite index reaches or exceeds 15,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the NASDAQ Stock Market. If the index does not reach 15,000 points during this period, this part resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 15,000 points. If either (a) or (b) resolves as YES, the overall question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following will take place by their deadlines: (a) the reinstatement of the U.S. SEC's climate disclosure regulation by July 2024, or (b) the NASDAQ Composite index achieving or surpassing 15,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if either of the following happens: (a) By July 31, 2024, the climate disclosure rule of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, which was previously halted by a judicial ruling, is reinstated. question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for California to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:

1. The vote must be formally announced and executed by the state of California.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be disclosed through official state channels or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually carrying it out by the specified deadline does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Oregon regarding abortion rights before August 2024?

3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically aim to secure protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the result of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will either California or Oregon conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the Philippine government set to implement a closure of online trading platforms operated by Chinese entities by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, there are verified reports indicating that the Philippine government has effectively carried out a closure of online trading platforms managed by Chinese firms in the Philippines. Such enforcement must be reported by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (including Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and must involve official governmental actions that lead to the discontinuation of services for a considerable number of these trading platforms. In this context, 'considerable' refers to at least 50% of the recognized Chinese-operated online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of the enforcement. The closure must stem from a government policy or directive, rather than being the result of voluntary shutdowns or economic circumstances. If no enforcement that meets these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as FALSE.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is MDMA expected to receive FDA approval for PTSD treatment by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants official approval for MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) as a treatment for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive outcome, this approval must be verified through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must be specifically for the application of MDMA in the treatment of PTSD, not for any other medical condition or purpose. If such approval is not obtained by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly denies or postpones the approval past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will Mexican officials make an official announcement regarding the disbandment of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel?

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Mexican economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy manages to avoid entering a recession. For the purposes of this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Mexico's National Institute of Statistics and Geography. The response will be NO if the Mexican economy records two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 15-year mortgage surpass 5.5% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, at any time in August 2024, the typical interest rate for a 15-year fixed mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 5.5%. If the interest rate does not exceed 5.5% at any time during August 2024, the answer will be NO. To clarify, the rate must go above 5.5%, not just match it.

question.title: Will Nevada maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Nevada remains at $11 per hour or higher. If the wage is reduced below $11 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Nevada state law.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a reported rise in North American interest for Tostitos by PepsiCo?

This increase must be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo, and confirmed by a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The rise in demand should be explicitly mentioned or clearly suggested in the company's financial disclosures or official announcements. If no such rise is reported by the given date, or if PepsiCo indicates a persistent decline or stagnation in interest for Tostitos in North America, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body:

2. The strike must persist for a minimum of one week.
3. The conclusion must be verified by official announcements from both Google and the relevant union.
4. The conclusion must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no agreement fulfilling all these conditions is reached by the given date, or if no major strike takes place, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will more than 450,000 individuals be enrolled in Washington's Medicaid expansion program by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the Medicaid expansion program in Washington has successfully enrolled in excess of 450,000 residents by the date of July 31, 2024. The enrollment numbers must be validated by official announcements from the state or reported by a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). Should the enrollment fail to surpass 450,000 by the specified resolution date, or if trustworthy data is unavailable, the answer will be negative. The enrollment total pertains to the number of individuals who are newly eligible under the Medicaid expansion initiative, excluding those who were already qualified for Medicaid.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is a public vote on abortion rights expected in New York before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially carries out a public vote that specifically aims to establish protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the New York state authorities.
2. The public vote must clearly address the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be reported by official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is cancelled or postponed beyond the given date.
3. A public vote is conducted, but it does not specifically aim to establish protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the result of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the stated timeframe.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will the Bank of Korea announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of Korea declare a decrease in its primary interest rate before August 2024?

If no such declaration occurs by the designated date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for two consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for two consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

2. The strike must persist for no less than one week.
3. The resolution must be verified by official announcements from both Alibaba Group and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these conditions is not reached by the given date, or if no major strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Indonesia in response to religious freedom legislation by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

The demonstrations must be clearly associated with the topic of religious freedom laws. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the lawsuit against Massachusetts' initiative on crisis pregnancy centers be ongoing in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the lawsuit filed by a conservative law firm against Massachusetts' initiative targeting crisis pregnancy centers is still ongoing in court. If the lawsuit has been dismissed, settled, or reached a final judgment by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Google come to an agreement to end a significant employee strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Google successfully negotiates with the unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Google employees (a minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The duration of the strike must be at least one week.
3. Confirmation of the resolution must be provided through official communications from both Google and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be reported by no fewer than two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution satisfying all these conditions is reached by the given date, or if there is no significant strike, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will either the Washington Lottery offer online products or Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Washington Lottery officially launches any of its products for online purchase or play. This must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Washington Lottery or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as local Washington newspapers, national news outlets, or industry-specific publications). The online products must be accessible to the general public within Washington and allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify for a YES resolution.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Washington Lottery will introduce online products or that Google will settle a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following takes place by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Washington Lottery officially initiates any of its offerings for online purchase or engagement. This must be validated by an official declaration from the Washington Lottery or reports from no fewer than two credible news outlets (such as local Washington newspapers, national news organizations, or industry-specific journals). The online offerings must be available to the general public in Washington and facilitate real-money transactions. Trial phases or restricted rollouts to selected groups do not qualify for an affirmative resolution.

(b) Google comes to an agreement with unionized employees, leading to the cessation of a major strike. For this resolution to be deemed legitimate, the strike must involve a considerable number of Google employees (at least 1,000 participants), persist for a minimum of one week, and the resolution must be corroborated by official announcements from both Google and the relevant union. Furthermore, the resolution must be reported by at least two trustworthy international news agencies (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the indicated date, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will Huawei announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Huawei officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Huawei's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is Huawei set to reveal strategies for cutting down on electricity use linked to AI by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, Huawei makes a formal declaration of particular strategies aimed at lowering electricity consumption associated with its AI activities. The declaration must be communicated through official company platforms (such as press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (for instance, Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The strategies disclosed should be tangible actions or initiatives intended to reduce the energy consumption of Huawei's AI systems. If no such declaration occurs by the stated deadline, or if the disclosed strategies do not specifically address AI-related electricity usage, the inquiry will be considered NO.

question.title: Will Twitter announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Twitter publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Twitter only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Is Twitter set to reveal intentions to expand its workforce focused on AI by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, Twitter makes a public declaration regarding plans to expand its workforce dedicated to AI. The declaration must occur through official company communication channels (such as press releases, statements for investors, or verified social media accounts) or be reported by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (for instance, Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The expansion of the AI-related workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely suggested from broader hiring strategies. If no such declaration is made by the given date, or if Twitter only states it will maintain or reduce its AI-related workforce, the inquiry resolves as FALSE. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of plans, rather than the actual execution of those plans.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Huawei officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. para_P.title: By July 2024, will either of the following happen: (a) Huawei declare initiatives to lower electricity usage associated with AI, or (b) Twitter reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce?

question.title: Will BNSF Railway reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both BNSF Railway and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will a new contract concerning work schedule predictability be established between BNSF Railway and the conductors' union before August 2024?

The contract should clearly tackle the matter of enhancing schedule predictability for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing negotiations. If no such contract is established, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced contract fails to specifically address work schedule predictability, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Colorado implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Colorado has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local Colorado newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. If no additional state adopts such a measure by the resolution date, or if the implementations are for different waiting periods, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will any additional U.S. state establish a 72-hour waiting period for voter registration by the end of August 2024?

The waiting period must be exactly 72 hours; any shorter or longer durations do not qualify. If no further state enacts such a regulation by the resolution date, or if the measures involve different waiting periods, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Ohio remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Ohio officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

The employment prerequisite refers to the stipulation that beneficiaries are required to work or participate in other qualifying activities in order to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the employment prerequisite remains in effect, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly increases are reported by the resolution date, or if only one or two months show an increase, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a rise in sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. for three straight months by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by the end of July 2024, there are three successive months during which the sales of previously owned houses in the U.S. demonstrate an upswing compared to the prior month. The information must be validated by credible sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other well-established real estate market experts. The increases should be expressed in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If there are no such consecutive monthly increases reported by the resolution date, or if only one or two months show an increase, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major cholesterol medication by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, include a major cholesterol medication and are confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of the medication must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the medication is not included in the negotiated prices by this date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will a significant cholesterol drug be part of Medicare's negotiated pricing?

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the French economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not fall into a recession. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. Conversely, the response will be NO if the French economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the preferred inflation metric of Mexico's Central Bank exhibit a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Mexico's Central Bank's favored inflation metric indicates a month-to-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any individual month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially disclosed by the Central Bank of Mexico or an appropriate Mexican governmental body and reported by a minimum of two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero). If such an increase is not recorded during this timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed negative. Please note that this inquiry pertains specifically to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any alternative duration.

question.title: Will either the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024 or the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?

The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). para_P.title: Is it possible for the French economy to steer clear of a recession by July 2024, or for the inflation metric preferred by the Central Bank of Mexico to indicate a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by that same date?

The inquiry will be deemed NO if the French economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The inflation measure favored by the Central Bank of Mexico shows a month-over-month increase that exceeds 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially reported by the Central Bank of Mexico or an appropriate Mexican government agency and confirmed by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero). If there is no such reported increase during this timeframe, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Los Angeles by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. question.title: Will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are verified reports indicating more than 10 deaths linked to the E. coli outbreak connected to lettuce from a particular supplier. Verification must come from reliable sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or similar health organizations, and be reported by at least two trustworthy news agencies. The fatalities must be specifically related to this outbreak and should not include deaths from other E. coli incidents. If the death count stays at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. For this question, only deaths directly associated with this specific outbreak will be considered.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak, or (b) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:
   - An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
   - A press release from Sara Lee
   - An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
   - Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
   The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

(b) There are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, either (a) Sara Lee will announce a recall of its packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak, or (b) the E. coli outbreak associated with lettuce will lead to over 10 confirmed fatalities?

   The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the withdrawal of the products.

(b) There are verified reports indicating that more than 10 deaths have been linked to the E. coli outbreak connected to lettuce from a particular producer. Official verification must come from trustworthy sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations. The reported fatalities must be specifically associated with this outbreak and should not include deaths from unrelated E. coli infections.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the designated date, the inquiry will conclude as negative.

question.title: Will a Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sony Corporation come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike before July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with the unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of employees from Sony Corporation (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The duration of the strike must be a minimum of one week.
3. Confirmation of the resolution must be provided through official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
4. The resolution must be reported by no fewer than two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution that satisfies all these conditions is not achieved by the given date, or if no major strike takes place, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. keep a full 100% tariff on machinery imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. still enforces a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery from China. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be confirmed through official U.S. government channels (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (for instance, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Should the tariff be lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the resolution will be NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are clearly indicated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank maintain the Selic rate at 13.25% or higher in August 2024?

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?

The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Indonesia's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indonesia's economy does not fall into a recession. A recession is characterized for this question as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Indonesian economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.
