question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing measles outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current measles outbreak by August 2024?

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the factory initiative by a South Korean battery firm in Ohio will be scrapped by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that the South Korean lithium-ion battery firm's intention to construct a factory in Ohio has been officially abandoned. Verification must be provided through official announcements from the company, the Ohio state government, or at least two reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The abandonment must represent a total cessation of the project, rather than a mere postponement or alteration. If the project remains active, is under consideration, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the inquiry will be answered with NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, 'abandonment' indicates that the company has formally retracted its plans or that the state has decisively turned down the project.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible for South Korea's KOSPI index to hit or surpass 3,500 points by August 2024?

question.title: Will a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be reports of a government-created AI system disseminating election falsehoods by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are trustworthy reports or official alerts from election officials, government entities, or credible news organizations indicating that a government-created AI system is disseminating election falsehoods. For this question, 'election falsehoods' pertains to inaccurate or misleading information regarding election procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Trustworthy reports should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or leading US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:

2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

question.title: Will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

This declaration must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Brazil, such as a press release, a monetary policy statement, or a public address by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The declaration should clearly specify the new inflation target and must be covered by at least two major financial news outlets (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil retains the current inflation target, this part will be answered with a NO. (b) The Global Fund formally announces new funding commitments that total more than $400 million by July 31, 2024. The announcement(s) must be made via official Global Fund channels (like their website or press releases) and reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of existing programs, not merely continuations of prior commitments. If no such announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not surpass $400 million, this part will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' be the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' remains the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. The ranking must be based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues.

para_P.title: Will 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' achieve the status of the top-grossing R-rated film by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' is still the top-grossing R-rated film globally, not adjusting for inflation, by August 31, 2024. The ranking should be determined by total box office revenue as reported by a minimum of two credible sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If another R-rated film exceeds its earnings by this deadline, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' relinquishes its leading position at any time prior to the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. Only theatrical releases are taken into account for this question, with streaming or VOD revenues excluded.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not fall into a recession. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The answer will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

The ranking must be based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the condition is not met. Only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues. (b) The UK economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. If the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, the condition is not met. The question resolves as NO if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

If any other R-rated film exceeds its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' is no longer in the top position at any time before the resolution date, the condition fails. question.title: Will Universal Studios Hollywood workers approve a new labor agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. If no such approval is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the agreement is rejected, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the employees of Universal Studios Hollywood give their consent to a new labor contract by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the employees at Universal Studios Hollywood, represented by the unions involved in the latest discussions, grant their approval to a new labor contract with Universal. The contract in question must pertain to the negotiations discussed in recent news regarding the prevention of a possible strike. If such approval is not confirmed by the resolution date, or if the contract is turned down, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of the Philippines announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Central Bank of the Philippines will declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved affirmatively if the Central Bank of the Philippines makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates that is set to take effect by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through official communications from Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, including press releases, statements from the Monetary Board, or public addresses by Bank representatives. If such a declaration is not made by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved negatively. It is important to note that while the actual implementation of the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, the announcement must be made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which serves as the primary instrument of monetary policy for the Central Bank of the Philippines.

question.title: Will Facebook implement court-ordered changes to its advertising policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Facebook implements any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Changes may include, but are not limited to, modifications in ad targeting, pricing models, or advertiser agreements. If no such changes are implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

para_P.title: Will Facebook enact changes to its advertising policies mandated by a court ruling before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Facebook puts into effect any modifications to its advertising policies due to a federal court decision concerning antitrust issues. The changes must be verified through official statements from Facebook, court filings, or coverage by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Possible changes may encompass, but are not restricted to, alterations in ad targeting, pricing structures, or agreements with advertisers. If such modifications are not implemented and verified by the resolution date, the answer will be NO. Please note that this question does not take into account any appeals or stay orders that may postpone the implementation of changes.

question.title: Will New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in New York regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and carried out by the state of New York.
2. The central theme of the public vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communication or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such public vote that meets these conditions occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually executing it by the specified deadline does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mercedes-Benz is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Mercedes-Benz's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

3. The legal action must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets.

question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Hillshire Farm recall its sausage products because of a listeria outbreak before August 2024?

2. A press release issued by Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically indicating a recall by Hillshire Farm
4. Reports from a minimum of three prominent news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) referencing official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these criteria is declared by the designated date, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will the FDA issue a recall for ground ginger products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to withdraw their products from the marketplace.

If either of these situations occurs by their specified deadlines, the question will resolve as YES. If neither happens, it will resolve as NO.

To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Canada. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of environmental policy changes. question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States still enforces a 100% tariff on the importation of textiles manufactured in China. If the tariff is decreased to below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time leading up to and including August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. Temporary halts or exemptions of the tariff that are specifically indicated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The Central Bank of Indonesia announces a new monetary easing policy, or (2) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (1) The Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (2) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, either (1) the Central Bank of Indonesia will declare a new monetary easing strategy, or (2) the Singapore Straits Times Index will hit or surpass 4,000 points?

This declaration must originate from an authorized communication channel of the Central Bank of Indonesia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank. The announcement should clearly outline the new monetary easing strategy. It must be covered by a minimum of two prominent financial news organizations (for example, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. (2) The Singapore Straits Times Index achieves or exceeds 4,000 points at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trustworthy financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If neither of these events occurs by the given date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Nigeria's legislative body approve a significant economic reform proposal that President Tinubu is against by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's legislative body approves a significant economic reform proposal that is clearly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To be valid:

1. The proposal must pertain to economic policy, including areas such as fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the legislative body, irrespective of whether it is enacted into law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be distinctly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The proposal must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets regarding its potential influence on the Nigerian economy.

If no such proposal is approved by the legislative body by August 31, 2024, or if a proposal is approved but fails to meet all the specified criteria, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Bayer permit the production of generics for its heart medication by July 2024?

This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that allows for unrestricted generic manufacturing. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements by the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or significant national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation occurs by the given date, or if Bayer continues to assert its patent rights, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be credible reports indicating that TikTok's AI-based content recommendations are responsible for disseminating misinformation related to elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, there exist credible reports or official alerts from election officials, governmental bodies, or trustworthy news organizations indicating that TikTok's AI-based content recommendations are responsible for disseminating misinformation regarding elections. For the purposes of this inquiry, 'election misinformation' is defined as inaccurate or misleading information concerning election procedures, candidates, or results. Credible reports must originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The reports or alerts must explicitly reference TikTok's AI and its involvement in the spread of election misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are made by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: Is the factory initiative of the Chinese battery firm in Michigan going to be scrapped by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if it is verified by August 31, 2024, that the Chinese lithium-ion battery firm's intention to construct a $2.36 billion facility in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially abandoned. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two reliable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The abandonment must represent a total cessation of the project, rather than merely a postponement or alteration. If the initiative remains active, under consideration, or has not been formally scrapped by this date, the response will be NO. In this context, 'scrapping' indicates that the company has officially retracted its intentions or that the state has unequivocally denied the project.

question.title: Will either TikTok's AI be reported for spreading election misinformation or the Chinese battery factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?

question.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Colorado state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion restriction be affirmed by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a judicial decision validates the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion restriction. The validation must originate from a court in Colorado and be reported by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent US newspapers). If the restriction is not affirmed as constitutional by the designated date, or if a court finds it unconstitutional, the inquiry will resolve as NO. For this question, a 'near-total abortion restriction' pertains to the law that was halted and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, Rhode Island continues to enforce a red flag law as part of its gun safety laws. If the law is repealed or significantly altered by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Rhode Island uphold its red flag legislation until the end of August 2024?

para_P.title: Will Colorado's almost complete abortion prohibition be upheld as constitutional or will Rhode Island sustain its red flag legislation until August 2024?

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the average interest rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US to dip under 5.0% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average interest rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as documented by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, drops below 5.0% at any time. The rate must be verified by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two trusted financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not decrease below 5.0% by the designated date, or if Freddie Mac stops providing this data, the inquiry will conclude as NO. To clarify, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be regarded as falling below 5.0%.

question.title: Will Jerome Powell remain as Federal Reserve Chair through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Jerome Powell is still serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Federal Reserve announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Will Jerome Powell continue to serve as the Chair of the Federal Reserve until July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if Jerome Powell is still in the role of Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. If he is no longer in the Chair position by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or term expiration), the inquiry will resolve as NO. para_P.title: By August 2024, will the average 15-year mortgage rate in the US drop beneath 5.0%, or will Jerome Powell continue to serve as the Federal Reserve Chair until the end of July 2024?

question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Missouri state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Missouri-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will there be a statewide vote in Missouri regarding abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri officially holds a statewide vote focused on the issue of establishing abortion rights within the state constitution. The vote must be formally declared by the Missouri state government and confirmed by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant news outlets based in Missouri). The voting process must be accessible to all eligible voters in Missouri and should primarily address abortion rights. If such a vote does not take place or is not finalized by the resolution date, or if the vote is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. Please note that this question is solely concerned with the occurrence of the vote, not its result.

question.title: Will the American Federation of Teachers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the American Federation of Teachers (AFT) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official AFT statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

para_P.body: This inquiry will result in a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the American Federation of Teachers (AFT) officially backs a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must explicitly show support for a particular candidate in the 2024 presidential contest. If no such backing is given or made public by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO. para_P.title: By July 2024, will either of the following take place: (a) a referendum regarding abortion rights is held in Missouri, or (b) a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election receives an endorsement from the American Federation of Teachers?

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Spain remove export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially declares or puts into effect a policy to entirely abolish export duties on agricultural goods. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Merely reducing export duties or eliminating them for only certain agricultural goods will not suffice for a YES resolution. If no such policy is enacted or introduced by the resolution date, or if only partial actions are taken, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. announce an exceptional yield for both corn and soybeans by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. officially announces an exceptional yield for both corn and soybeans, reflecting yields that are significantly above the average of the past five years. An exceptional yield is characterized as a crop output that exceeds the average by a considerable margin, generally at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Verification must be obtained from official statements by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) or from at least three credible news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If an exceptional yield is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no exceptional yield is reported for either crop, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Spain eliminates export taxes on agricultural products, or (b) the United States reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions is met by their respective dates: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. (b) By August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that by August 2024, either (a) Spain will abolish export duties on agricultural goods, or (b) the United States will announce an exceptional harvest for both corn and soybeans?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if one of the following scenarios occurs by the specified deadlines: (a) By July 31, 2024, the government of Spain makes an official declaration or takes action to completely remove export duties on agricultural goods. This policy must be verified through official government announcements or covered by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). A mere reduction in export duties or the removal of duties on select agricultural goods will not suffice for a YES resolution. (b) By August 31, 2024, the United States makes an official announcement of an exceptional harvest for both corn and soybeans, signifying yields that are significantly above the average when compared to the preceding five years. An exceptional harvest is characterized as a yield that exceeds the average by a considerable margin, generally at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must be sourced from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If neither scenario occurs, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current West Nile virus epidemic by August 2024?

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Land O'Frost recall deli meat products due to a listeria contamination before August 2024?

(b) Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?

question.title: Will Tennessee conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Tennessee.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

para_P.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion prohibition be nullified by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's statute that restricts most abortions after roughly six weeks of gestation is either rescinded by the state legislature or annulled by a judicial ruling. The rescission or annulment must be verified by official announcements from the state or reported by at least two credible news outlets. If the statute is still in effect as of July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. In this context, 'nullified' refers to the law no longer being enforceable in its existing form, whether through legislative measures or court decisions.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

Reliable reports should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in reputable journals. (b) Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro publicly expresses condemnation of the assault on Maria Corina Machado's office that took place in 2023. The statement must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be clear and unequivocal, directly addressing the attack on Machado's office.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will California obtain more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?

The funding must be clearly earmarked for electric vehicle-related projects within California. para_P.title: Is there a possibility that President Biden will speak at a National Education Association gathering in Illinois before July 2024, or that California will obtain more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not overturned or substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a standard second-trimester procedure. Conversely, this inquiry will be considered FALSE if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will be determined based on official court rulings or reliable reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will Florida maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. para_P.title: Will Florida uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has not overturned or substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common procedure during the second trimester. The inquiry will conclude as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or restored the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. question.title: Will either Virginia or Florida maintain their current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either the Virginia Supreme Court or the Florida Supreme Court (or both) have not reversed or significantly altered their 2023 decisions that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, both the Virginia Supreme Court and the Florida Supreme Court have reversed their decisions, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia or Florida uphold their existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, neither the Virginia Supreme Court nor the Florida Supreme Court (or both) have overturned or substantially modified their 2023 rulings that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a commonly used second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the inquiry will yield a NO if, by July 31, 2024, both the Virginia Supreme Court and the Florida Supreme Court have overturned their rulings, reinstated more stringent regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from a minimum of three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will IBM terminate at least 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has officially announced the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization plan focused on AI. Official confirmation must be derived from company announcements, regulatory documents, or reports from a minimum of two trustworthy news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan revealed in 2023. If IBM confirms a lesser number of terminations, or if there is no confirmation meeting these requirements by the resolution date, the answer will be NO. Partial terminations or gradual implementations that do not meet the 1,800 staff member threshold by the resolution date will also lead to a NO resolution.

question.title: Will Tiff Macklem remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of Canada announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Will Tiff Macklem continue to hold the position of Governor of the Bank of Canada until July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Tiff Macklem is still in the role of Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer in the role of Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or the conclusion of his term), the inquiry will be answered with a NO. For the context of this inquiry, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not count as Macklem continuing in the role.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) IBM will lay off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or (b) Tiff Macklem will remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada?
